title: Launch Roundup: NASA’s PACE mission, Chinese art satellites, and more Starlink missions
summary: February is set to get off to a busy start with two Chinese launches. A Chinese multistage solid rocket, Jielong-3, will launch from a barge in coastal waters off Yangjiang in the South China Sea on Feb. 2 at around 03:00 UTC. The payload consists of at least five satellites for a rideshare mission, including an interactive art installation venture, led by artists Xu Bing and Beijing Wanhu Creation.

title: NASA Earth science mission once slated for cancellation ready for launch
summary: A nearly billion-dollar mission to study the Earth’s oceans and atmosphere is ready to launch after surviving several cancellation attempts earlier in its development.

title: NASA’s PACE Climate Sat Ready to Fly
summary: After nearly nine years of planning, preparation, and even once being slated for cancellation entirely, NASA’s Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) Earth-observation mission is set for launch. Initially conceived in 2015, PACE will finally reach orbit and begin its planned  3-10 year mission on a launch currently slated for February 6, 2024 at 1:33 AM.

title: Falcon 9 set to launch PACE science satellite for NASA
summary: After a record-setting month featuring 10 launches, SpaceX is gearing up for a busy February. One of the launches scheduled for this month is the Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) ocean science satellite, set to fly aboard a Falcon 9 in a rare polar corridor launch from Florida.
